intro: Petalolepis, commonly known as the "spiny water lily," is a genus of aquatic plants belonging to the family Nymphaeaceae. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or white, with a distinctive spiny structure on the petals. The leaves are broad and floating, often with a waxy surface to repel water. Petalolepis species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and are commonly found in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats. These plants play an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
